question.para: Why can't I add/remove entries from the Default Policies tab?

answer.para: The default policies ensure that all possible traffic is handled by a Virtual Rack. Deleting one of these entries without a corresponding entry in the Custom Policies tab would cause the ⪚ not to know how to handle some types of traffic.

question.para: I only want to scan inbound email traffic, not outbound. Do I need to create a new Virtual Rack and Policies?

answer.para: No. Many Software Appliances (including all of those which scan email) let you directly configure behaviors for inbound vs. outbound traffic.

question.para: We are using the ⪚ with its VPN Software Appliance. Do I need to configure extra Virtual Racks for the VPN users?

answer.para: You do not have to create extra Virtual Racks/Policies in order to use VPN. The VPN interface is, by default, inside the external and DNZ interfaces, but outside of the internal interface. The single Default Rack is correct for most deployments.

One situation where you would need to do so if you want to scan traffic differently for different VPN users. If you consider all VPN users are equivalent, just route the Policies dealing with the VPN interface to Default Rack.
